decks.notes: This Merfolk deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Merfolk Trickster and Harbinger of the Tides, alongside lords like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis, to quickly overwhelm opponents with a swarm of powerful creatures. The deck also includes protection in the form of Force of Will and Chalice of the Void, as well as card advantage from cards like Silvergill Adept. Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play while Cavern of Souls ensures they can't be countered. True-Name Nemesis is a difficult to deal with threat that can close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, then storm off with spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to play multiple spells in one turn. The deck aims to dig through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder to find the key pieces like Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to win the game. Thoughtseize and Duress help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Infernal Tutor and Dark Petition help to find specific combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through disruption spells like Spell Pierce, Force of Will, and Daze, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, True-Name Nemesis, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Delver of Secrets. The deck also utilizes powerful utility cards like Wrenn and Six, Abrupt Decay, and Lightning Bolt to handle threats and maintain tempo. By efficiently using its mana base and having a mix of disruption and threats, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent in a fast-paced aggressive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's resources while slowly building up a strong land base. By using cards like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Crop Rotation, the deck can disrupt the opponent's plans and mana base. The key win condition revolves around assembling the Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths combo to create a powerful 20/20 indestructible creature. The deck also utilizes Life from the Loam to continuously recycle lands from the graveyard and maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through attrition.

The concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and True-Name Nemesis, while utilizing efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect your threats. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Daze, while providing card advantage and recursion with cards like Brainstorm and Wrenn and Six. The overall strategy is to control the game tempo and win the game through early aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to protect the combo, along with acceleration from Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide. The land base is optimized for efficiently finding and utilizing the combo pieces, with additional utility lands like Karakas and Bojuka Bog for added versatility. The deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively through its powerful combo.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly drop powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield while using aggressive burn spells and disruptive control elements to control the pace of the game. By combining early mana acceleration with devastating threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, along with disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Sun, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. It is a fast-paced, high-risk, high-reward strategy that aims to close out games quickly through a combination of brute force and tactical disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage and tempo. The deck utilizes a mix of traditional control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as newer cards like Arcum's Astrolabe and Teferi, Time Raveler. The win condition comes from cards like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, which can quickly close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of removal spells and counterspells to control the game while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six to provide additional value and disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements, while cards like Plague Engineer and Baleful Strix help deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory through attrition and resource management.

The primary goal of this deck is to assemble the Mystic Forge combo as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Paradox Engine, Basalt Monolith, and Voltaic Key to generate infinite mana and play through the deck with Mystic Forge. Defense Grid helps protect the combo from disruption, while cards like Chalice of the Void and Ensnaring Bridge slow down the opponent. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and access to artifacts to optimize the combo. The deck aims to win through a powerful and resilient combo engine with a strong control package.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and manipulate the library with Ponder and Brainstorm. The Stoneforge Mystic package provides additional threats and equipment to close out the game, while True-Name Nemesis and Teferi, Time Raveler provide protection and disruption. The deck looks to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis to apply constant pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Magmatic Sinkhole to deal with opposing threats. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana development while also providing access to Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful, low-cost creatures like Death's Shadow and Delver of Secrets, supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain control through a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The inclusion of cards like Reanimate and Gurmag Angler adds additional versatility and potential for explosive plays. The mana base is tailored to provide the necessary colors while also incorporating utility lands like Wasteland for disrupting the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis, while controlling the board with disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Lightning Bolt. It aims to pressure the opponent with aggressive plays while maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes essential lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck's strategy revolves around deploying threats quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a fast victory.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain aggressive pressure while controlling the opponent's board through card advantage and tempo plays. It utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, backed up by disruptive spells such as Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to quickly build up its board presence while keeping the opponent on the back foot with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt. With a strong mana base and card selection spells, it aims to outpace opponents and secure a swift victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck aims to aggressively control the board by using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also utilizes cards like True-Name Nemesis and Wrenn and Six to provide board presence and card advantage. With a strong mana base and versatile removal options like Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to apply pressure early on while maintaining control of the game through countermagic and efficient creatures.
